direction.raw_text: Sad, sad, sad. To think of the opportunities that boy had. This should be a lesson to us all that our children need constant supervision. She puts her arm around Cecile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all about quality time. 106  INT. VALMONT TOWNHOUSE - SEBASTIAN'S BEDROOM - DAY         106 Annette enters Sebastian's room, now cleaned up. She walks around the room, taking it in, then approaches the window. She stares out of it for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He loved that view. Annette turns and sees Kathryn at the door. She enters the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see why. Kathryn extends her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Kathryn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annette Harrison. They shake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have we met?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know Sebastian well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You might say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I remember. Annette Harrison. Your father's the new headmaster at Oakwood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure you're going to love it there. Annette nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'll leave you alone now. I just came in here to get something of mine. Kathryn walks over to Sebastian's desk and takes the keys to his Porsche. She goes to leave, when she turns back to Annette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure you're going to be alright? I'm here if you need a friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I know this sounds corny, but whenever I feel like I can't go on I... (takes out her crucifix) turn to Jesus and he helps me through the problem. Call me an anachronism, but -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh cut the shit, Kathryn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell do you think you are coming into my house and saying those things to me. My brother is dead, have some respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kathryn, I know all about you and Sebastian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian was a pathological liar. I wouldn't believe a word he -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have his journal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His journal. He sent it to me the day before he died. Everything about you is in it. The blow jobs, the hand jobs, the menages, your bout with bulimia, the affair you had with your guidance counselor and how he gave you... eww. Let's see, then there's your coke problem... You still keep it in your crucifix, don't you? It's all in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't show it to anybody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, I was planning on running down to Kinkos. Do you think you could give me ride?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't do this to me. It could ruin me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Kathryn starts to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kathryn, please. Crying? Didn't you once say that crying is a sign of weakness? I'm very disappointed in you. Kathryn continues to sob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, stop crying. There's a bright side to this you know. Annette puts a comforting arm around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to be my pet project next year. You're going to do what I tell you to do, wear what I tell you to wear. You're going to befriend the unpopular, sleep with the insecure. Think of the social ramifications it will cause. You and I are going to turn this school around. And do you know why you're going to do it? (beat) Cause your ass is mine. Annette grabs Kathryn by the face, KISSES her forcefully on the mouth, then shoves her back. Kathryn looks at her in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll be in touch. She winks at Kathryn then leaves. CLOSE ON: Kathryn. She sits down on Sebastian's bed, utterly defeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgot something. Annette steps back into frame and takes the car keys out of Kathryn's hands. 107  INT. PORSCHE - DAY                                         107 Annette races down the highway. She opens up the glove compartment and rifles through some cassettes. She takes out The Carpenter's Greatest Hits and inserts it. CUE UP: The Carpenter's singing "Goodbye To Love." Annette reaches down and takes out Sebastian's sunglasses. She puts them on and checks herself out in the rear-view mirror. A grin crosses her face. 108  EXT. WESTSIDE HIGHWAY - AERIAL POV. - DAY                  108 We MOVE off the Porsche and ascend into the air. The Porsche weaves through traffic as it disappears into a sea of cars. WE SEE the Manhattan skyline in the background as WE -
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 69   EXT. HIGHWAY/INT. PORSCHE - DAY                            69 Sebastian is talking on his cell phone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 94   INT. RONALD'S BEDROOM - NIGHT                              94 Ronald is sleeping. The phone rings. He awakens and answers it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sebastian walks the streets of New York. He seems sad and lonely.
dialogue.name: dialogue
